sentences: Mehed läksid kaklema ja peksid kortsu segi.
context: The Estonian word 'segi' is an adverb that has multiple related meanings: 1) In a state of mess, disorder, or being mixed together - describing things that are scattered, jumbled, or in chaos; 2) Abstractly meaning out of normal circumstances or in unwanted situations; 3) Describing living beings who are not fully in control of themselves, lacking full self-control, perception, or reason. It can refer to physical disorder, mental confusion, or emotional states where someone is overwhelmed.
